title: Ngan
text:
A ngan (, , ) is a unit of <a href="area">area</a>, equal to 400 <a href="square%20metre">square metre</a>s (20 m × 20 m), used for measuring land or property area. Its current size is precisely derived from the <a href="metre">metre</a>, but is neither part of nor recognized by the modern <a href="metric%20system">metric system</a>, the <a href="SI">International System</a> (SI).
The ngan equals 1/4 <a href="Rai%20%28area%29">rai</a> or 100 <a href="tarang%20wa">tarang wa</a> () "aka" square <a href="Wa%20%28unit%29">wa</a> (), very nearly 1/10 of an <a href="acre">acre</a>. "Ngan" also means "work".
It is commonly used in <a href="Thailand">Thailand</a> and equals four <a href="Hectare%23Are">are</a>, another unit based on the metre and as commonly used in several countries recognized though not encouraged by the SI.
As for many terms normally written in <a href="Thai%20alphabet">Thai alphabet</a>, transliteration into English language caused a spelling variant, "ngaan".
